title: Server Attention Span
alt: They have to keep the adjacent rack units empty. Otherwise, half the entries in their /var/log/syslog are just 'SERVER BELOW TRYING TO START CONVERSATION *AGAIN*.' and 'WISH THEY'D STOP GIVING HIM SO MUCH COFFEE IT SPLATTERS EVERYWHERE.'
transcript:
[Single server in a server rack.]
Server: Hi! I'm a server! Who are you?[Mobile device with a web browser.]
Browser: I'm a browser. I'd like to see this article.Server: Oh boy! I can help! Let me get it for— ...Whoa! You're a smartphone browser?Browser: Yeah.
Server: Cooool! Hey, I've got this new mobile version of my site! Check it out! Isn't it pretty?Browser: Sure, but this is just your mobile site's main page. Where's the article I wanted?Server: What article?
Browser: The one I—
Server: Who are you?
Browser: I—
Server: Hi! I'm a server!
